result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

NESJA,  AVERY    CASE:  H22100901

Possession of Cocaine
Possession of Methamphetamine
Possession of Drug Parapheranalia

11:27 AM  DE Avery Nesja in court, appearing in custody by video from the Sawyer County Jail, with Atty Gabriel Pollak  (special appearance) appears by video.  Kenneth Sortedahl  appeared by video for the State of WI.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  DE verifies DOB and Address.  DE  does qualify for public defender.  Court finds probable cause.  State makes bond recommendation.  Atty Pollak no objection.  Court sets bond.  Court sets INITIAL APPEARANCE for October 18, 2022  at 8:30AM.
